text: Can I hold it, please? Yeah, I will take care...
Can I water these?
Give me orange...
See where are you? Get down!
I love you... Uh...uh...uh...uh...uh...uh...ouch!
Grazie.
I know English... Monday...Tuesday...Thursday...Wednesday... Friday...Sunday...Saturday... Andiamo! Andiamo!
Come on! Let's go! Let's go!
Michael is teaching me to drive - watch, I'll show you.
Michele...Michele, Let's go... let's go... you promised me.
Michele, wait there! I'll drive to you...
We're all grateful to Don Corleone for calling this meeting. We all know him as a man of his word...a modest man...he'll always listen to reason...

Times have changed. It's not like the Old Days when we can do anything we want. A refusal is not the act of a friend. If Don Corleone had all the judges, and the politicians in New York, then he must share them, or let us others use them. He must let us draw the water from the well. Certainly he can present a bill for such services; after all we are not Communists.
Then we are agreed. The traffic in drugs will be permitted, but controlled and Don Corleone will give up protection in the East and there will be the peace.
Look, we are all reasonable men here; we don't have to give assurances as if we were lawyers...

I believe in America. America has made my fortune. And I raised my daughter in the American fashion. I gave her freedom, but I taught her never to dishonor her family. She found a boyfriend; not an Italian. She went to the movies with him; she stayed out late. I didn't protest. Two months ago, he took her for a drive, with another boyfriend. They made her drink whiskey. And then they tried to take advantage of her. She resisted. She kept her honor. So they beat her, like an animal. When I went to the hospital, her nose was a'broken. Her jaw was a'shutted, held together by wire. She couldn't even weep because of the pain. But I wept. Why did I weep? She was the light of my life ... beautiful girl. Now she will never be beautiful again.
Sorry...

I-I went to the police, like a good American. These two boys were brought to trial. The judge sentenced them to three years in prison ... suspended sentence. Suspended sentence! They went free that very day! I stood in the courtroom like a fool. And those two bastard, they smiled at me. Then I said to my wife, "for justice, we must go to Don Corleone."
What do you want of me? Tell me anything. But do what I beg you to do.
I'll give you anything you ask.
I didn't want to get into trouble.
I ask you for justice.
Then they can suffer then, as she suffers. How much shall I pay you?
Be my friend... Godfather?
Grazie, Godfather.
Yes. What do you want me to do?
Luca, I'm Bruno Tattaglia.
Su bequero Scotch? Pre-war...
Hey, Paulie! I got two gavagool? Gabagone?... and a...
Come on.
Stop bothering me with this rich America stuff!
Corleone.
They're dead from vendettas. There are the names of the dead.
Michele. In Sicily, women are more dangerous than shotguns.
... tempt the devil...
... together
A bocca...
... a purple ribbon...
Piu Greca d'Italiana
Ah -
She's going to surprise you - she wants to drive.
She'll make a good American wife. Wait, I'll get the baggage...
Shut up and set the table...
I knew that was gonna happen soon as they started makin' big money.
Hey shut up, Connie, when Sonny's talking...
Hey look, Sonny, Tom I'd like to talk to you maybe after dinner. I could be doing a lot more for the Family.
This fat slob's still bettin' the Yankees pretty heavy? You tell 'em to stop takin' action on 'em, alright? We lost enough money last week on the game...
I'm not hungry yet.
I'll eat out later.
Hey, bafangool, eh? Leave me alone.
What the hell is she up to now, this little guinea brat...
That's it, break it all you spoiled guinea brat...break it all!
Maybe I will! Why not? Yeah you, ga'head...
Now clean it up!
Clean it up! Clean it up, you guinea spoiled brat! Clean it up! Clean it up, I said clean it up! Clean that up! Clean it up!
Clean it up! Clean that up you son-of-a- bitch! Clean it! Clean it up! Yeah yeah...come on now, kill me. Be a murderer like your father. Come on, all you Corleones are murderers anyway.
Come on, you kill me. Get out here! Get out here!
Ga'head...now I'll kill you! You guinea brat you! Get out here!
Thank you, Papa...
Hey Connie, please. What do you want?
All right.
Mike, you got it all wrong...
Mike, I'm innocent. I swear on the kids, Mike. Please, Mike, don't do this to me.
Mike, don't do this to me, please...
It was Barzini
Mike, please...
Sal...Tom...the Boss says he'll come in a separate car. He says for you two to go on ahead...
Well, that's what he said.
Excuse me, Sal...
Hey, Paulie! Let me have some wine. Paulie! More wine...
Hey, what are you a dance judge or something? Go take a walk around the neighborhood. Do your job.
There's more news about your old man. The word is out on the street that he's already dead.
Jesus Christ; take it easy...take it easy
Paulie was out sick. He been calling sick all winter.
Only maybe three or four times. I mean -
I asked Freddy if he wants me to get a different bodyguard and he said no.
Yeah. You want me to send any people over here?
Mike, your mother's over in the hospital with your father; looks like he's gonna pull through, thank God.
... it's a lot of bad blood. Sollozzo, Philip Tattaglia, Bruno Tattaglia; Garbone...
Eh, I've been trying all night. He might be shacked up.
Hey, Paulie, I thought I told you to stay put.
Understood.
It's a Sicilian message. It means Luca Brasi sleeps with the fishes.
I'm goin' now...
I don't know, probably late.
Yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah...
That Sonny's runnin' wild. He's thinkin'a going to the mattresses already. We g otta find a spot over on the West Side. Ya try - 309 West 43rd Street. You know any gooda spots on the West Side?
Well think about it while you're drivin', will ya? I wanna hit New York sometime this month. And watch out for the kids while you're backin' out.
Leave the gun. Take the cannoli.
Some girl... the music ends.

Hey, Mikey, why don't you tell that nice girl you love her? I love you with all-a my heart! If I don't see you again soon, I'm a-gonna die! Heh, come over here, kid, learn something. You never know, you might have to cook for twenty guys someday. You see, you start out with a little bit of oil. Then you fry some garlic. Then you throw in some tomatoes, tomato paste, your fry it; ya make sure it doesn't stick. You get it to a boil; you shove in all your sausage and your meatballs; heh?... And a little bit o'wine. An a little bit o'sugar, and that's my trick.
Oh, Paulie? Won't see him no more...
Aw, he'll be alright. Sollozzo knows he's a civilian
What's with all the new faces?
Jesus Christ... It looks like a fortress around here...
Mike is right...
It's as cold as they come...impossible to trace, so you don't worry about prints, Mike. I put a special tape on the trigger, and the butt. Here, try it... What's the matter, the trigger too tight?
Yeah, I left it noisy - that way it scares any pain-in-the-ass innocent bystanders away.

Come on kid, don't fool around. Just let your hand drop to your side, and let the gun slip out. Everybody'll still think you got it. They're gonna be staring at your face, Mike...so walk outta the place real fast but you don't run. Don't look nobody directly in the eye...but you don't look away, either. Hey, they're gonna be scared still of you, believe me, so don't worry about nothin'. You know, you're going to turn out all right. You take a long vacation...nobody knows where and we're gonna catch the hell.

Pretty goddamn bad. Probably all the other Families will line up against us. That's alright...this things gotta happen every five years or so...ten years helps to get rid of the bad blood. Been ten years since the last one. You know you got to stop them at the beginning, like they should have stopped Hitler at Munich, They should've never let him get away with that. They were just asking for big trouble. You know, Mike, we was all proud of you - being a hero and all. Your father, too.
We could put a tail on them and see how it turns out...
He's over at my place playin' pinochle with a couple of my men. He's happy, the y're lettin' him win...
The negotiator keeps on playing cards until Mike comes back safe and sound.
Too dangerous - they'd be lookin' for that.

All right, Mike: you go to the restaurant, you eat, you talk for a while, you relax. You make them relax. Then you get up and you go take a leak. No...better still...you ask for permission to go. Then when you come back, you come out blastin', and don't take any chances...two shots in the head apiece.
The gun'll be there...
Come on, let's move...
You don't forget: two shots apiece in the head soon as you come out the door, ah? Let's go...
Very nice...!
Don Corleone you once said that the day would come when Tessio and me could form our own Family. Til today, I would never think of it. I must ask your permission...
How long with that be?
And I hate that goddamn Barzini! In six months' time there won't be nothing left to build on...
Yes...
Yes - always, Godfather...
Hello, Carlo...
Don Corleone...
Open up. It's Clemenza.
Hey, Paulie, I want you to go down 39th Street. Carlo Santos you pick up 18 -
...mattresses for the guys to sleep, while you bring me the bill...
Ya'know, you make sure they're clean, cuz those guys'll be stuck up in there for a long time, ya'know?
Exterminate? That's a bad word to use: exterminate! Get this guy. Watch out we don't exterminate you laughs.
Hey, Paulie - Did you fart?.
Pull over, will yah? I gotta take a leak.
Hey, Mike! Hey, Mikey?
You're wanted on the telephone.
We got to protect ourselves. Give me a chance to recruit some new men.
Johnny! Johnny! Johnny! I love you!
But I like bread!
What's the matter with you, Carlo?
Well Papa never talked business at the table, and in front of the kids.
It was my fault!
Sonny, please, it was my fault. Sonny, it was my fault! I hit him. I started a fight with him. Please let me be. I hit him, so he hit me. I didn't...I -
Sonny, please don't do anything...please don't do anything!
Hello...hello?
Who's this?
... bitch!
Dinner's on the table...
The food is on the table. It's getting cold.
You just told me to make you dinner!
Ah, bafangool, you!
Why don't you bring... Why don't you bring your whore home for dinner? And get...
Aw, like hell I will!
You son-of-a-bitch!
I will! I will! I hate you! I'll kill you! I'll kill you!
I hate you!
Come on, kiss your Godfather...
Oh, Mike it's our first vacation together.
Whattaya tryin' to tell me!
Aw Mama, please! Michael! Michael!
Where is he? Michael!

Michael! You lousy bastard you killed my husband! You waited until Papa died so nobody could stop you, and then you killed him. You blamed him for Sonny. You always did. Everybody did. But you never thought about me. You never gave a damn about me. Now what am I going to do?

Why do you think he kept Carlo at the mall? All the time he knew he was gonna kill'im. And you stood Godfather to our baby you lousy cold-hearted bastard. Want to know how many men he had killed with Carlo? Read the papers - read the papers! That's your husband! That's your husband!
No! No! No!
I am Enzo, the baker. Do you remember me?
Yes, Enzo...
If there is trouble, I stay here to help you. For your father...for your father.
Okay... okay.
I kiss your hand, Don Tommasino.
Tell us something about New York.
We heard.
Somebody told us you were a real important...how do you say...a pezzonovante. A big shot.
Ah...Is America as rich as they say?
Eh, shut up... Eh, take me to America. If you need a good lupara in America, take me...I'd be the best man you can get. Oh, say can you see? By the dawn's early light? Ah?
Hey, hey, take me to the America, G.I.!
Mama mia what a beauty.
Oh...I think you got hit by the thunderbolt.
You know all the girls around here? We saw
Really put together, eh Calo?
Such hair...such mouth!
This one had a purple dress and a purple ribbon in her hair.
... a type more Greek than Italian.
Do you know her?
My God, I understand!
Let's go. It's his daughter.
You don't understand. It's his daughter!
Si, Signor.
Yes...
Are you driving yourself, Boss?
Is your wife coming with you?
Okay anything you say, Boss.
Hey! Hey, hey, hey, take me to the America, G.I.! Clark Gable! Eh! America, America, va! take me to the America, G.I.! Clark Gable!
some real beauties. One of them struck our friend like a thunderbolt. She would tempt the devil himself.
How'ya doing? This is my brother, Mike.
Huh? yeah... This your friend, huh?
Okay, Pop - I'll have to get it myself, Pop; Paulie called in sick this morning.
Paulie's a good kid, I don't mind getting the car.
Okay, Pop
I can't...I can't...Papa!!
I'm going to learn... the... casino business...

I can't get over the way your face looks... it really looks good. This doctor did some job. Who talked you into it, Kay? Hey hey hey hey hey, wait! Hey - leave them out here we'll deal with them later... He's tired - he wants to clean up. But right now, let me open the door, alright?
It's all for you, kid - eh It's all his idea, right? Didn't you?
Well it was - hey, girls here... Hah...I'll be right back...
You keep 'em occupied... Anything you want, kid...anything. Huh?
That's for you to find out...
Hey, Mike... uh...
Hey, just take off! Come on, take off! Let's go. Hey - Angelo... Hey, come on. SCRAM!
Come on... I don't know, Johnny. I don't know what the hell's the matter with him. I'm sorry, babe, come on... I don't know, he's tired... he's...
He said he had some business. He said give him a call when the party started.
Hey, Mike, are you sure about that? Moe loves the business - he never said nothin' to me about selling...
Aw now that...that was nothin', Mike. Now uh Moe didn't mean nothin' by that. Sure he flies off the handle once in a while, but Moe and me we're good friends, right Moe? Huh?
Wait a minute, Moe...Moe, I got an idea... Tom...Tom, you're the Consiglieri and you can talk to the Don - you can explain...
Mike! You don't come to Las Vegas and talk to a man like Moe Greene like that!
Come on, Mikey...
They might, they just might...
For my Connie...
"I have but one heart..."
"My darling, until I saw you..."
"... this love I bring you I have but one heart To share with you I have but one dream That I can cling to You are the one dream..."
"...I dream comes true..."

I don't know what to do. My voice is...is weak. It's weak. Anyway, uh, if I ha d this part in the picture, ya'know, it puts me right back up on top again. But this, uh...this man out there, he won't give it to me; the head of the studio.
Woltz...Woltz. He won't give it to me...and ah, he says there's no chance. No chance.

A month ago he bought the movie rights to this book. A bestseller and the main character, it's a guy just like me. I uh...I wouldn't even have to act...just be myself. Oh, godfather, I don't know what to do. I don't know what to do.
Sure I do.
It's too late, they start shooting in a week.
All right
Hello, Mike. Welcome to Las Vegas!
Well, your brother Freddy...
All right...okay
Come on, honey, let's go
Hello, Mike nice to see you again.
Thanks, Mike.
Well I uh, owe it all to him.
Mike, what can I do?
Sure, Mike. I'll do anything for my Godfather...you know that.
Michael, that man over there is talking to himself. See that scary looking guy over there?
Well, who is he? What's his name?
Oh, Michael, wait a minute; he's coming over here...
How do you do, Tom
Nice to meet you. If he's your brother, why does he have a different name?
What's that?
Mike, you never told me you knew Johnny Fontane!
Huh? Oh, well, sure!
He did? How?
Oh, Michael...
Please, Michael, tell me.
How'd he do that?
What was that?
Oh, hi
No, Michael, not me.
I got something...I got something for your mother, and for Sonny, and a tie for Freddy, and Tom Hagen got the Reynolds pen...
Me? Oh, just you.
Thank you Michael, it's 3 o'clock
It's 3 o'clock. We hafta get up because we have to go to your father's house...
Because we have to, ya know.
Uh-huh...
Why not?
Well, alright then I...then we won't go...we won't tell your father...
You know, we'll just get married first and we'll tell'em later...
Then Michael, get outta bed.
Michael, they're expecting us!
What are you gonna do?
What are you doing? What are you doing?
I can't do this.
Hello, this is long distance calling...I have a collect call from Mr. Michael Corleone...um, will you accept the charges?
One moment, please...
Mike, would you like me better if I were a nun? Like in the story, you know?
Then would you like me better if I were Ingrid Bergman?
Michael...
Michael...
Michael...
Can I go with you?
Well, I'll ride in the cab...
When will I see you again?
When will I see you again, Michael?
Yes, well...I have. I mean I've tried writing and calling. Now I want to reach Michael.
Uh… What was that?
Tom… Will you give this letter to Michael, please? Please?
I let my cab go so can I come in to call another one, please?
Come on, Nancy...keep together, everyone. Blanche. Okay, all right... How long have you been back?
But you're not like him, Michael. I thought you weren't going to become a man like your father. That's what you told me...
You know how naive you sound?
Senators and presidents don't have men killed...
Michael, why did you come here? Why? What do you want with me after all this time? Here I was calling and writing...
Please stop it, Michael...
It's too late...it's too late...
Oh, Michael...
Okay... Oh, Michael. Michael, your sister wants to ask you something...
No she's afraid to. Connie and Carlo want you to be Godfather to their little boy.
Will you?
What is it?
Connie...
Michael, is it true?
Is it true?
No.
Is it true? Is it?
I guess we both need a drink, huh?
How's your father?
I love you.
I love you. Michael?
Tell me you love me...
Can't you say it?
Okay
Don Corleone, I am honored and grateful that you have invited me to your home...
I know
Io no bib' "I don't drink".
I know you.
What's in it for me?.
Not bad.
Grazie.
Don Corleone, I am honored and grateful that you have invited me to your home on the wedding day of your daughter. And may there first child be a masculine child. Don...Don Corleone...

Don Corleone, I am honored and grateful that you have invited me to your daughter's wedding... ... on the day of your daughter's wedding. And I hope that their first child be a masculine child. I pledge my ever-ending loyalty.
For your daughter's bridal purse.
Don Corleone, I'm gonna leave you know, because I know you are busy.
No...no...no! Assesta stori!
Carlo, we're gonna take the picture...
Ooohh...
Santino... don't interfere.
Connie, what's a' matter. I can't hear you, what is it? Connie, talk louder...the baby's crying. Santino, I can't understand...I don't know ...I don't understand 'er...
What's the matter?
What's the matter?
Statta bene... statta bene
Look I'm trying to tell you you're wrong!
Why you little punk! What the hell are you doing telling me my business? I pulled them guys off of here, eh! Now you get outta here and stay away from this hospital!
Phil, take him in!
Goddamn it, I said take him in!
Take a hold of him. Stand him up. Stand'im up straight.
Alright... let'im go. Come on!

Ahh, he's a good kid. I'm sorry about the other night, Mike. I gotta frisk you, so turn around uh...on your knees, facing me. Ah, I guess I'm gettin' too old for my job. Too grouchy...can't stand the aggravation. You know how it is... He's clean.
How's the Italian food in this restaurant?
I'll have it.
Go ahead...
You gotta go, you gotta go... I frisked him - he's clean.
I've frisked a thousand young punks...
He's a very scary guy.
His name is Luca Brasi an' he helps my father out sometimes.
Oh!
My brother, Tom Hagen. This is Kay Adams.

Oh, ah, that...when my brother Sonny was a kid, he found Tom Hagen in the street. And he had no home and so my father took him in - and he's been with us ever since . He's a good lawyer. Not a Sicilian, but I think he's gonna be consiglieri.
That's um, like a counselor...an advisor...very important to the family. You like your lasagna?
Sure... You wanna meet him?
My father helped him with his career.
Let's listen to the song...

Well, when Johnny was first starting out, he was signed to this personal service contract; with a big band leader. And as his career got better and better, he wanted to g et out of it. Now, Johnny is my father's godson. And my father went to see this band leader, and he offered him $10,000 to let Johnny go. But the band leader said no. So the next day, my father went to see him; only this time with Luca Brasi. And within an hour, he signed a release, for a certified check for $1,000.
My father made him an offer he couldn't refuse.
Luca Brasi held a gun to his head, and my father assured him that either his brains or his signature would be on the contract. That's a true story. That's my family, Kay. It's not me.
Oh! How are you, Fredo? Fredo...my brother Fredo...this is Kay Adams
Are you having a good time?
Wait a minute...
And what do you want for Christmas?
What?
Why do we have to?
If we go to my father's house -
- we can't push the beds together...
Because they're in separate rooms.
Okay...
I can't do that...
We'll go tomorrow...
Oh, Kay...get the phone...
Just get the phone...
Hi, may I please have Orchard-9-9539 please...
You're going to be the long-distance operator from New Hampshire. Come on...
You gotta...come on...
Hello?
Hello, Tom, how are you?
Listen we're up in New Hampshire still we're gonna drive down tomorrow mo rning...
Okay...
Bye, Tom...
No.
Now that's a thought...
No, I would not like you better if you were Ingrid Bergman.
What's the matter?
They don't say if he's dead or alive...
Sonny...Michael.
Is he all right?
Yeah, I'm here.
Didn't Tom tell you? I called.
Alright...
You kill all those guys?
Yeah?
Who is it?
Hello, Kay?
He's good. He's gonna make it.
Huh?
Yeah, I know.
I can't talk...
Eh...I'll see you tonight.
To the city.
... no, I'm just going to the hospital to see pop.
Yes, sir...
I have to go...
You know, Kay, there's gonna be detectives there...people from the press...
I don't want you to get involved...
Go back to New Hampshire, and I'll call you at your parents' house.
I don't know...
I'm Michael Corleone...this is my father. There's nobody here. What happened to the guards?
Ah, Get me, ah, Long Beach-4-5620, please... Nurse, wait a minute. Stay here. Sonny, Michael. I'm at the hospital.
Listen I got here late. There's nobody here.
Nobody... no no no Tessio's men, no detectives, nobody. Papa's all alone.
I won't panic!
Uhh... You and I are gonna moo...move my father to another room. Now can you disconnect those tubes so we can move the bed out?
You know my father? Men are coming here to kill him. You understand? Now help me, please.
Who are you?
Enzo...
You better get out of here, Enzo; there's gonna be trouble...
Alright... Listen, wait for me outside in front of the hospital. Alright? I'll be out in a minute. Go ahead...
Just lie here, Pop. I'll take care of you now. I'm with you now. I'm with you...
Get rid of these
You did good.
What happened to the men who were guarding my father, captain?
I'm not moving until you put some guards around my father's room.
What's the Turk paying you to set up my father, Captain?
We can't wait.
We can't wait. I don't care what Sollozzo says about a deal, he's gonna kill Pop, that's it. That's the key for him. Gotta get Sollozzo.

They wanna to have a meeting with me, right? It will be me, McCluskey and Sollozzo. Let's set the meeting. Get our informers to find out where it's gonna be held. Now, we insist it's a public place...a bar, a restaurant...some place where there's people so I feel safe. They're gonna search me when I first meet them, right? so I can't have a weapon on me then. But if Clemenza can figure a way to have a weapon planted there for me, then I'll kill 'em both.
Sonny...
Where does it say that you can't kill a cop?

Tom, wait a minute. I'm talking about a cop that's mixed up in drugs. I'm talking about ah... ah... a dishonest cop...a crooked cop who got mixed up in the rackets and got what was coming to him. That's a terrific story. And we have newspaper people on the pay roll, don't we, Tom? Hagen nods in the affirmative. And they might like a story like that.
It's not personal, Sonny. It's strictly business.
Oh, my ears...
Sit down, finish my dinner...
How bad do you think it's gonna be?
How much time do we have?
Yeah, a million times.
How long do you think it'll be before I can come back?
Tom.
We'll straighten everything out tonight. I don't want my father bothered any more...
We're goin' to Jersey?
I understand that...
... come si diche...? What I want? What's most important to me is that I have a guarantee: No more attempts on my father's life.
I have to go to the bathroom. Is that all right?
I'm with Calo and Fabrizio...
Did Santino say when I can go back?
Grazie.
Corleone.
No. I want to walk.
How do you know I'm from New York?
Where?
I'm the son of a pezzonovante.
Bravo!
Where have all the men gone?
What's wrong?
Tell him to come here.
No, no, no, no. Call him.
Fabrizio...traducce per me.
I apologize if I offended you...
I am a stranger in this country...
And I meant no disrespect to you, or your daughter...
I am an American...hiding in Sicily...
My name is Michael Corleone...
There are people who'd pay a lot of money for that information...
But then your daughter would lose a father...
... instead of gaining a husband.
I wanna meet your daughter...
... with your permission...
... and under the supervision of your family.
With all respect.
Grazie e como se chiama, vostra figlia?
Bene.
Prego.
No, no...it's okay...
It's safer to teach you English!
Aie, bravo!
A salute, Don Tommasino.
How are things in Palermo?
Come va Palermo?
What's wrong?
Fabrizio!
Prepara la macchina.
Yes...
No - I want you to take her to her father's house til I know things are safe...
Calo, dové Apollonia?
Ahh...
Fabrizio! Dove vai?
NO! No, Apollonia!
Appolonia...?
Fabrizio...? Get me - Get me - Fabrizio. Find him... Fabrizio.
Pop, what about Sonny? What about Sicily?
But won't they take that as a sign of weakness?
Well you gave your word that you wouldn't break the peace, I didn't give mine. You don't have to have any part. I take all responsibility.
I've been back a year. Longer than that, I think. It's good to see you, Kay...
I'm working for my father now, Kay. He's been sick...very sick.
My father's no different than any other powerful man. Any man who's responsible for other people. Like a senator or a president.
Why?

Oh who's being naive, Kay? Kay, my father's way of doing things is over...it's finished. Even he knows that. I mean in five years, the Corleone Family is going to be completely legitimate. Trust me. That's all I can tell you about my business Kay...
I came here because I need you ... because I care for you.
Because I want you to marry me...

Please, Kay I'll do anything you ask ... anything to make up for what's happened to us... ... because that's important Kay. Because what's important is that we have each other. That we have a life together that we have children. Our children... Kay I need you. And I love you.
After we make the move to Nevada you can break off from the Corleone Family and go on your own. After we make the move to Nevada.
Six months.

There are things being negotiated now that are gonna solve all your problems and answer all your questions. That's all I can tell you now... Carlo, you grew up in Nevada. When we make our move there, you're gonna be my right- hand man. Tom Hagen's no longer Consiglieri. He's gonna be our lawyer in Vegas. That's no reflection on Tom, but that's the way I want it. Besides if I ever need help, who's a better Consiglieri than my father? Well, that's it.
You're not a wartime Consiglieri, Tom. Things may get rough with the move we're trying.
You're out, Tom.
Who are the girls?
Get rid of them, Fredo.
Fredo, I'm here on business. I leave tomorrow, now get rid of them. I'm tired. Get rid of the band, too.
What happened to Moe Greene?
Well give him a call. Johnny, how are you?
We're all proud of you...
Sit down, Johnny - I want to talk to you. The Don's proud of you, too, Johnny.
Well he knows how grateful you are. That's why he'd like to ask a favor of you...

The Corleone Family is thinking of giving up all its interests in the olive oil business - settling out here. Now Moe Greene will sell us his share of the casino and the hotel so it could be completely owned by the Family. Tom.

Yeah well I'll make him an offer he can't refuse. See, Johnny...see we figure that entertainment will be a big factor in drawing gamblers to the casino. And, we hope you'll sign a contract to appear five times a year. Perhaps uh...convince some of your friends in the movies to do the same. We're counting on you...
Good.
How are you, Moe?
My credit good enough to buy you out?
The casino...the hotel. Corleone Family wants to buy you out.
Your casino loses money. Maybe we can do better...
You're unlucky

Wait a minute. You took Freddie in because the Corleone Family bankrolled your casino because the Molinari Family on the Coast guaranteed his safety. Now we're talking business. Let's talk business...
Is that why you slapped my brother around in public?
You straightened my brother out?
I leave for New York tomorrow. Think about a price.
Fredo - you're my older brother, and I love you. But don't ever take sides with anyone against the Family again. Ever.
I have to see my father and his people, so have dinner without me...
This weekend we'll go out. We'll go to the city. We'll see a show and we'll have dinner. I promise.
Well let her ask...
Oh, well we'll see...
Lemme think about it - we'll see. Come on.
It's good for you, Pop.
Very happy...
No, not at all...
He's good.
He's smarter than I am. Three years old, he can read the funny papers

What's the matter? What's bothering you? I'll handle it. I told you I can handle it, I'll handle it.
Another pezzonovante...
We'll get there, Pop. We'll get there...
You talked to him?
Alright...
They're arranging a meeting in Brooklyn. Tessio's ground, where I'll be "safe".

It's a smart move - Tessio was always smarter. But I'm gonna wait - after the baptism. I've decided to be Godfather to Connie's baby. And then I'll meet with Don Barzini - and Tattaglia - all of the heads of the Five Families...
I do.
I do.
I do.
I do renounce them.
I do renounce them.
Kay...
Carlo can't go to Vegas. Something's come up. Everybody's going to leave without us.
Go back to the house. Wait for my call. It's important.
I'll only be a couple of days...
You have to answer for Santino, Carlo.
You fingered Sonny for the Barzini people. Ahhh that little farce you played with my sister. You think that could fool a Corleone?
Sit down.

Barzini's dead. So is Phillip Tattaglia, Moe Greene, Strachi, Cuneo. Today I settle all Family business, so don't tell me you're innocent, Carlo. Admit what you did. Get him a drink. Come on. Don't be afraid, Carlo. Come on, you think I'd make my sister a widow? I'm Godfather to your son, Carlo. Go ahead, drink it...drink No Carlo you're out of the Family business, that's your punishment. You're finished. I'm putting you on a plane to Vegas. Tom?
Good. There's a car waiting for you outside to take you to the airport. I'll call your wife, to tell her what flight you're on.
Come on. Get outta my sight.
Come on...
Get her upstairs. Get her a doctor.
She's hysterical. Hysterical.
Don't ask me about my business, Kay...
Don't ask me about my business...
Enough! Alright. This one time Michael points his finger...this one time I'll let you ask me about my affairs...
No.
Come 'ere... Put your hand in your pocket like you have a gun. You'll be alright. You'll be okay...
I want you to stay there. Understand? Only don't tell me you're innocent. Because it insults my intelligence and makes me very angry... Now who approached you? Tattaglia or Barzini?

Just be patient...
Be patient.

Buy me out?
The Corleone Family wants to buy me out? No. I buy you out, you don't buy me out.
You think I'm skimmin' off the top, Mike?
You goddamn guineas really make me laugh. I do you a favor and take Freddie in when you're having a bad time, and then you try to push me out!

Yeah  let's talk business, Mike. First of all, you're all done. The Corleone Family don't even have that kind of muscle anymore. The Godfather's sick, right? You're getting chased out of New York by Barzini and the other Families. What do you think is going on here? You think you can come to my hotel and take over? I talked to Barzini. I can make a deal with him, and still keep my hotel!
I gotta business to run. I gotta kick asses sometimes to make it run right. We had a little argument, Freddy and I, so I had to straighten him out...
He was banging cocktail waitresses two at a time! Players couldn't get a drink at the table! What's wrong with you?
Son-of-a-bitch - Do you know who I am? I'm Moe Greene! I made my bones when you were going out with cheerleaders!
But towards the end, he was uh paroled to help with the American uh war effort. So for the last six months he's been working in my pastry shop.
Well now that the war is over, this boy, Enzo...they want to repatriate him back to Italy. Godfather, I have a daughter. You see, she and Enzo...
You understand everything.
Mr. Hagen, thank you. An' wait til you see the beautiful wedding cake I made for your daughter! Ooof! Like this! The bride and the groom and the angel...
What are you doing here? You're not supposed to be here now!

I'm sorry; but you will have to leave.

Twenty... Thirty-grand. In small bills, cash. In that little silk purse. Maron, i f this was someone else's wedding, sweet tonato!

Bene. Don Corleone. I need a man who has powerful friends. I need a million dol lars in cash. I need, Don Corleone, those politicians that you carry in your pocket, like so many nickels and dimes.
Thirty percent. In the first year, your end should be three-four-million dollars. And then it would go up.

$50,000...to start with..
Agreed?
Tom! Tom Hagen! Merry Christmas! Heh, I'm glad I run into you; I want to talk to you.
Aw, make time, consiglieri. Get in the car. What are you worried about? If I wanted to kill you, you'd be dead already. Get in.

Your boss is dead. I know you're not in the muscle-end of the family, Tom, so I don't want you to be scared. I want you to help the Corleone's, and I want you to help me. Yeah, we got him outside his office just about an hour after we picked you up. Drink it. So now it's up to you to make the peace between me and Sonny. Sonny was hot for my deal, wasn't he? And you knew it was the right thing to do.

That'll be his first reaction, sure. That's why you gotta talk some sense into him. The Tattaglia family is behind me with all their people. The other New York Families will go along with anything that will prevent a full-scale war. Let's face it, Tom, and all due respect, the Don, rest in peace, was slippin'. Ten years ago could I have gotten to him? Well now he's dead. He's dead, Tom, and nothing can bring him back. So you gotta talk to Sonny, you gotta talk to the caporegimes, that Tessio and Fat Clemenza. It's good business, Tom.
Yeah, well, let me worry about Luca. You just talk to Sonny - and the other two kids.
Good. Now, you can go. I don't like violence, Tom. I'm a business man. Blood is a big expense.
He's still alive. They hit 'em with five shots, and he's still alive! Well that' s bad luck for me, and bad luck for you if you don't make that deal!
I'm glad you came, Mike. I hope we can straighten everything out. I mean, this is terrible. It's not the way I wanted things to go at all. It should've never happened.

He won't be, Mike; I swear on my children he won't be. But you gotta keep an op en mind when we talk. I mean, I hope you're not a hothead like your brother Sonny. You can't talk business with him... something in Italian.
Maybe...
Nice work, Lou.
Good...try the veal...it's the best in the city.
Capide? All right. I'm gonna speak Italian to Mike.
Me dispiace? What happened to your father was business? I have much respect for your father but your father...his thinking is old fashioned. You must understand why I had to do that...
Now let's work through where we go from here...
What guarantees could I give you, Mike? I am the hunted one! I missed my chance. You think too much of me, kid. I'm not that clever. All I want, is a truce.
Don't take too long...
Everything alright? - Look - Your father...
Santino Corleone?
We have Tom Hagen. In about three hours he'll be released with our proposition.
Listen to everything he has to say before you do anything. What's done is done. And don't lose that famous temper of yours, uh Sonny?

Hey Sandra, do me a favor, watch the kids. Don't let'em run wild, all right?

How many times has he been sick?
3, 4 times?
Listen, do me a favor, pick him up right now, I don't care how sick he is. If he's breathing, I want you to bring him to my father's house. Now, you understand? Now.
No. No. No. Just you and him. Ga'head.

Hello?

- try ringing him... Well, Tom you're consiglieri, now what do we do if the old man dies, God for bid.

Hey, Mickey, tomorrow get a couple of guys, you go over to Luca's apartment; hang around, waitin' for him to show up...
Yeah, listen, uh... hang around the house on the phone an' be a big help, huh? Try Luca again...go'head

Why don't you cut out the crap. I got more important things for you to do. How's Paulie?
Where you going?

Never mind; send somebody with him
Alright; be careful, huh?
Send somebody with him, anyway...
Tom-anuch! Hey, a hundred button men on the street twenty-four hours a day; that Turk shows one hair on his ass, he's dead.

Believe me... Hey, Michael, come're, let me look at you. You look beautiful! Beautiful! Just gorgeous! Hey, listen to this...the Turk wants to talk. Eh gosh...imagine the nerve of the sonofabitch, eh? Craps out last night, and wants a meetin' today...
What did he say...Badda-beep, badda-bap, badda-boop, badda-beep. He wants us to send Michael here to proposition. And the promise is, that the deal is so good, that we can't refuse. Eh...
That's part of the deal. Bruno cancels out what they did to my father...
No, no, no! No more! Not this time, consiglieri. No more meetin's, no more discussions, no more Sollozzo tricks. You
Then they hand me Sollozzo!
They shot my father...that's business? Your ass...
Well, then, business will have to suffer, alright? And listen...do me a favor , Tom. No more advice on how to patch things up, please. Just help me win, please, alright?
What about 'im?
Alright. We'll wait.
Huh?
Lemme ask you something...? What about McCluskey? Huh? What do we do with this cop here?

Hey, whataya gonna do, nice college boy, eh? Didn't want to get mixed up in the Family business, huh? Now you wanna gun down a police captain, why, because he slapped ya in the face a little bit? Hah? What do you think this is, the Army, where you shoot 'em a mile away? You've gotta get up close like this and bada-bing! you blow their brains all over your nice Ivy League suit. Come're...
You're taking this very personal. Tom, this is business and this man is taking it very very personal.
They're gonna pick you up in front of Jack Dempsey's joint in an hour and a half. Exactly an hour and a half.
Sollozzo'd lose our ass going around the block!
So why don't he just blast whoever's in the goddamn car?
I'll get it. Yeah...Yeah...Well, thanks... Louis' Restaurant in the Bronx.
That's my man in McCluskey's precinct. A police captain's gotta be on call twenty- four hours a day. He signed out at that number between eight and ten. Anybody know this joint?
Listen, I want somebody good and I mean very good...to plant that gun. I don't want my brother coming out of that toilet with just his dick in his hands, alright?
All right Listen, you drive him and you pick him up after the job, okay?
Did he...ah...tell you to drop the gun right away?

At least a year, Mike. Listen...um...I'll square it with Mom, uh - you know, you're not seeing her before you leave; and uh, I'll get a message to that girlfriend, when I think the time is right. Take care, huh?
All right. Here you are, big guy...give it to Grandpa.
Go with your mother Go ahead...take 'em downstairs...come on... Go on, Carlo - you, too. Go on...
They hit us so...we hit 'em back.
And I'm ah sending Fredo to Las Vegas, under the protection of... uh... Don Francesco of L.A...I want him to rest.
Yeah..
I want you to find out where that ol' pimp Tattaglia is hiding. I want his as snow right now!
What?

Well you just do what I tell you to do! Goddamn it! If I had a wartime consiglieri ...a Sicilian...I wouldn't be in this shape! Pop and Genco look what I got. I'm sorry, I didn't mean that. Ma made a little dinner - it's Sunday...
You know niggers are havin' a good time with uh...our policy banks up there in Harlem...drivin' them new Cadillacs...payin' fifty percent on a bet.
Yeah...

We don't discuss business at the table.
Hey! I'm gonna knock you dizzy. Save it for the library. Come on, we got to go pick up my sister...let's go.
Wha's the matter? Huh? What'sa matter?
Where is he?

Okay. What's the matter with you? What am I gonna do...I'm gonna make that baby an orphan before he's born or what? Huh? Hmmm? All right?
Carlo, come'ere! come'ere!, come'ere!, come'ere! You bastard!
You touch my sister again, I'll kill ya.
Shhhh. Yeah, Connie...
Listen you wait there.
No no...you just wait there! Sonofabitch.
Son-of-a-bitch!
Open the goddamn gate. Get off your ass.
Get out of here!
Son-of-a-bitch! Come on! Come on!
Michael, where you been?
We don't know yet. There's all kinds of stories. He was hit bad, Mikey... Are you there?
Where you been? I was worried.
No look, come home, kid. You should be with Mama, ya'hear?
Yeah?
What? Nobody?
Don't panic we'll send somebody...
Yes, Don Barzini...he's too modest. He had all the judges and politicians in his pocket. He refused to share them...
But I must have strict assurance from Corleone as time goes by and his position becomes stronger, will he attempt any individual vendetta?
We'll need'em now. After the hospital thing, Sonny got mad. We hit Bruno Tattaglia 4 o'clock this morning.

Yeah, sure, I do. It's perfect for us. A small family place, good food. Everyone minds his business. It's perfect. Pete they got an old-fashion toilet...you know, the box, and... and... and... ah the chain-thing. We might be able to tape the gun behind it.
Forgive me, Godfather, but with you gone me and Pete'll come under Barzini's thumb sooner or later...
Alright...
Mike, could I have a minute? Barzini wants to arrange a meeting. He says we can straighten any of our problems out...
Yeah - I can arrange security. On my territory. Alright?
Alright.
We're on our way to Brooklyn I hope Mike can get us a good deal tonight.
Hell, he can't do that. It screws up all my arrangements!
Tell Mike it was only business. I always liked him.
Huh? Tom can you get me off the hook? For Ol' Times' sake?
Barzini's people chisel my territory, and we do nothing about it. Pretty soon there won't be one place in Brooklyn I can hang my hat!
I'm not asking you for help, Mike - just take off the handcuffs.
Mike, you're wrong...
I have to go back to work.
It's part of the wedding: No Sicilian can refuse any request on his daughter's wedding day.
Who should I give this job to?
He's not on the list, but Luca Brasi wants to see you.
He didn't expect to be invited to the wedding, so he wanted to thank you.
Mike!
Heh...! You look terrific!
How do you do.
Your father's been asking for you. Very nice to meet you.
Senator Cauly apologized for not coming personally...he said you'd understand. Also, some of the judges. They've all sent gifts. Salute!
It's been two years; he probably got into trouble again.
Sonny? Sonny?
Sonny? Sonny you in there?
Your old man wants to see you.
In a few minutes, right after they cut the cake. Now you're new son-in-law; give him something important?
Virgil Sollozzo called. Now we're gonna have to give him a day sometime next week.
When am I going to California?
Uh, I was sent by a friend of Johnny Fontane's. His friend is my client, who' d give his undying friendship to Mr. Woltz, if Mr. Woltz would grant us a small favor.
Give Johnny the part in that new war film you're starting next week.
You're gonna have some union problems; my client could make then disappear. Also, one of your top stars has just moved from ah marijuana to heroin...
Absolutely not.
I'm German-Irish...

I have a special practice; I handle one client. Now you have my number; I'll wait for your call...by the way, I admire your pictures very much.
This is really beautiful.

I don't like to use his name unless it's really necessary.
Fine.
He's beautiful.
Mr. Corleone is Johnny's godfather. To the Italian people, that's a very religious, sacred, close relationship.
He doesn't ask a second favor once he's been refused the first, understood?
Thank you for the dinner and a very pleasant evening. If your car could take me to the airport; Mr. Corleone is a man who insists on hearing bad news immediately.

No, no. I slept on the plane. I have the Sollozzo notes here. Now Sollozzo is known as 'The Turk.' He's supposed to be very good with a knife, but only in matters of business or some sort of reasonable complaint. Uh, his business is narcotics. He has fields in Turkey where they grow the poppy. And in Sicily he has the plants to process them into heroin. Now he needs cash, and he needs protection from the police, for which he gives a piece of the action...I couldn't find out how much. The Tattaglia family is behind him here in New York. Now they have to be in it for something.
Two terms. One in Italy, one here. He's known as a top narcotics man.

Well, I say yes. There's more money potential in narcotics than anything else we're looking at. Now if we don't get into it, somebody else will. Maybe one of the Five Families, maybe all of them. Now with the money they earn, they can buy more police and political power; then they come after us. Now we have the unions, we have the gambling; an' they're the best things to have. But narcotics is a thing of the future. An' if we don't get a piece of that action, we risk everything we have...I mean not now, but ah ten years from now.
It's from ah Johnny, staring in that new, ah, film.
Take it over there.
Is there anything I can do for you?
Well I haven't got time
Sonny'll come after you with everything he's got.

I'll to my best.

Has anyone been able to get in touch with Luca?

If we lose the old man we lose our political contacts and half our strength. The other New York Families might wind up supporting Sollozzo just to avoid a long destructive war. This is almost 1946,
I'm as much a son to him as you or Mike.
Uh maybe we shouldn't get Mike uh mixed up in this too directly .

Now he's definitely on Sollozzo's payroll, and for big money. McCluskey has agreed to be the Turk's bodyguard. All the Five Families would come after you, Sonny. The Corleone Family would be outcasts! Even the old man's political protection would run for cover! So do me a favor take this into consideration.
Nothing. Not a hint. Absolutely nothing. Even Sollozzo's people don't know where the meeting's going to be held.

Since McCluskey's killing, the police have been cracking down on most of our operations - and also the other Families. There's been a lot of bad blood.
Through our contacts in the newspapers, we've been able to put out a lot of material about McCluskey being linked with Sollozzo in the drug rackets. See - things are starting to loosen up.

Well that's an accident, but nobody was hurt...
Well, if I accepted that in a court of law they could prove that I have knowledge of his whereabouts. Now you just be patient, Kay he'll get in touch with you, alright.

Sonny! Sonny, come on...
Move out. Go on!
Ah, I didn't tell Mama anything. I was about to come up and wake you just now and tell you...
Yup...
They shot Sonny on the Causeway. He's dead.
When I meet with the Tattaglia people, should I insist that all his drug middlemen have clean records?
You mean Tattaglia...
Mike, uh why am I out?
Maybe I could help...
Just a minute now - the Don is semi- retired and Mike is in charge of the Family business now. If you have anything to say, say it to Michael.
Do you know how they're gonna come at'cha?
I always thought it would've been Clemenza, not Tessio...

Hello?
Yes...
Hello?

Right...
Right, Mikey...
Michele, Why are you so far from the house? You know I'm responsible to your father for your life.
It's still dangerous. We've heard from Santino in New York. Your enemies know you're here.
Not yet. It's out of the question.
Where are you going now?
Take my car...
Accura! Be careful!

Young people don't respect anything anymore. Times are changing for the worse. This place has become too dangerous for you. I don't think you're safe here. I want you to move to a villa near Siracusa, right now...Subita, eh?
Bad news from America. Your brother, Santino, they killed him.
Morta.
Did you have a good hunt?
Ah, I understand...really put together...
Ah, he girls around here are beautiful but virtuous, ah?
NO! There's no girl like that in this town!
Who is this? He sounds American...
Come to my house Sunday. My name is Vitelli...
Apollonia.
E guesta mia figlia, Apollonia e guesto Michele Corleone.
What happened to your eye...
Why did you go to the police? Why didn't you come to me first?
What is that?
That I cannot do.

We've known each other many years, but this is the first time you came to me for counsel, for help. I can't remember the last time that you invited me to your house for a cup of coffee, even though my wife is godmother to your only child. But let's be frank here: you never wanted my friendship. And uh, you were afraid to be in my debt.

I understand. You found paradise in America, had a good trade, made a good living. The police protected you; and there were courts of law. And you didn't need a friend of me. But uh, now you come to me and you say "Don Corleone give me justice." But you don't ask with respect. You don't offer friendship. You don't even think to call me Godfather. Instead, you come into my house on the day my daughter is to be married, and you uh ask me to do murder, for money.
That is not justice; your daughter is still alive.

Bonasera... Bonasera... What have I ever done to make you treat me so disrespectfully? Had you come to me in friendship, then this scum that ruined your daughter would be suffering this very day. And that by chance if an honest man such as yourself should make enemies, then they would become my enemies. And then they would fear you.
Good. Some day, and that day may never come, I'll call upon you to do a service for me. But uh, until that day accept this justice as a gift on my daughter's wedding day.
Prego. Ah, give this to ah, Clemenza. I want reliable people; people that aren't gonna be carried away. I'm mean, we're not murderers, despite of what this undertaker says.
Where's Michael?
We're not taking the picture without Michael
Eh, Don Barzini.
Nazorine, my friend, what can I do for you?
You want Enzo to stay in this country, and you want your daughter to be married .
Bene.
Not to our paisan. Give it to a jew congressman, in another district. Who else is on the list?
Is this...is this necessary?
All right.
Thank you, Luca, my most valued friend.
Thank you.
What is that outside?
I'll take care of it. Tom, I want you to find Santino. Tell him to come to the office.
What's his name?
You can act like a man! What's the matter with you? Is this how you turned out? A Hollywood...? That ah cries like a woman? What can I do?! What can I do?! What is that nonsense? Ridiculous.
You spend time with your family?

Good. 'Cause a man who doesn't spend time with his family can never be a real m an. Come're. You look terrible. I want you to eat. I want you to rest a while. And in a month from now, this - Hollywood bigshot's gonna give you what you want.
I'm gonna make him an offer he can't refuse. Now you just go outside and enjoy yourself, and ah, forget about all this nonsense. I want you to leave it all to me.
Well...
What time does my daughter leave with the bridegroom?
Never. Give him a living, but never discuss the family business with him. What else?
We'll discuss it when you come back from California.
Want you to go tonight; I want you to talk to this movie bigshot, and settle this business for Johnny. Now, if there's nothing else, I'd like to go to my daughter's wedding.
You're not too tired, are you, Tom?
What about his prison record?
Santino? Whattaya think?
Tom?
What is the interests for my family?
And what is the interest for the Tattaglia Family?
So I receive thirty percent for finance political influence, and legal protection, that's what your telling me?
Why do you come to me? Why do I deserve this generosity?

I said that I would see you because, I heard that you're a serious man, to be treated with respect. But uh, I must say no to you and I'll give you my reasons. It's true, I have a lot of friends in politics, but they wouldn't be friendly very long if they knew my business w as drugs instead of
It...makes...it doesn't make any difference to me what a man does for a living, understand. But your business is ah...a little dangerous.
Wait a minute...

I have a sentimental weakness for my children, and I spoil them as you can see; they talk when they should listen. But, anyway, Signor Sollozzo, my no is final, and I wish to congratulate you on your new business, and I hope you do very well. And good luck to you...as best as your interests don't conflict with my interests. Thank you.

Santino, come're. Whattsa matter with you? I think your brain is going soft fro m all that comedy your playing with that young girl. Never tell anybody outside the family what you're thinking again! Go on... Tom... What...what is this nonsense?
Ah...Well, take it away.
And uh, tell Luca Brasi to come in.

I'm a little worried about this Sollozzo fella. I want you to find out what he' s got under his fingernails, ya'know. Go to the ah Tattaglia's, and ah, make them think that ah you're...you're not too happy with our family and...and ah find out what you can.
Andiamo, Fredo. Tell Paulie to get the car; we're going.
Huh?!
Buon nateli, Dano. Grazie
Aspetta, Fredo; I'm gonna buy some fruit aspetta...wait.
Hi, merry Christmas; I wan some fruit over there. What is this? Gimme three. And that one...
Where's Michael? Where's Michael?
Give me a drop... My wife is crying upstairs. I hear cars coming to the house. Consiglieri of mine, I think you should tell your Don what everyone seems to know...
But you needed a drink first.
Well, now you've had your drink.
I want all inquiries made. I want no acts of vengeance. I want you to arrange a meeting, with the heads of the Five Families. This war stops now.
Call Bonasera. We need him now.
Well, my friend are you ready to do me this service?
I want you to use all your powers and all your skills. I don't want his mother to see him this way... Look how they massacred my boy...

Don Barzini, I want to thank you for helping me organize this  meeting here today. And also the other heads of the Five Families, New York and New Jersey. Carmine Corleone from the Bronx and ah... Brooklyn...Philip Tattaglia.  An' from Staten Island, we have with us Victor Strachi. And all the other associates that came as far as from California, and Kansas City, and all the other territories of the country...thank you. How did things ever get so far? I don't know. It was so unfortunate...so unnecessary. Tattaglia lost a son and I lost a son. We're quits. And if Tattaglia agrees, then I'm willing to let things go on the way they were before...

When...when did I ever refuse an accommodation? All of you know me here. When did I ever refuse? Except one time. And why? Because I believe this drug business is gonna destroy us in the years to come. I mean, it's not like gambling or liquor...even women, which is something that most people want nowadays, and is ah forbidden to them by the pezzonovante of the Church. Even the police departments that've helped us in the past with gambling and other things are gonna refuse to help us when in comes to narcotics. And I believed that then and I believe that now.
I hoped that we would come here and reason together. And as a reasonable man I'm willing to do whatever's necessary to find a peaceful solution to these problems...

You talk about vengeance...is vengeance gonna bring your son back to you? Or my boy to me? I forgo the vengeance of my son But I have selfish reasons. My youngest son was forced to leave this country... Because of this Sollozzo business. All right ... and I have to make arrangements to bring him back here safely - cleared of all these false charges. But I'm a superstitious man and if some unlucky accident should befall him...if he should get shot in the head by a police officer or if he should hang himself in his jail cell or if he's struck by a bolt of lightning then I'm going to blame some of the people in this room. And that, I do not forgive. But that aside let me say that I swear on the souls of my grandchildren that I will not be the one to break the peace that we have made here today...
Mention it. Don't insist. Barzini is a man who'll know that without being told.
Tattaglia's a pimp...he never'a could've outfought Santino. But I didn't know until this day that it was Barzini all along...
Look at this tomatoes, peppers...all of this perfecto...
I swore that I would never break the peace.
It is a sign of weakness...
Well, we have a lot of time to talk about it now.
Well, Michael is now head of the Family, and if he gives his permission, then you have my blessing...
Do you have faith in my judgment?
Do I have your loyalty?
Then be a friend to Michael, and do as he says.
I'm happy for you, Carlo.

Tom I advise Michael. I never thought you were a bad Consiglieri. I thought Santino was a bad Don, rest in peace. Michael has all my confidence, as...as you do. But uh there are reasons why you must have no part in what is going to happen.

So Barzini will move against you first. He'll set up a meeting with someone that you absolutely trust...guaranteeing your safety. And at that meeting, you'll be assassinated. I like to drink wine more than I used to anyway, I'm drinking more...
I don't know your wife and children. Are you happy with them?
That's good. I hope you don't mind the way I...I keep going over this Barzini business...
It's an old habit. I spent my life trying not to be careless. Women and children can be careless, but not men. How's your boy?
You know he looks more like you every day.
Read the funny papers. Oh...well...eh, I want you to arrange to have a telephone man check all the calls that go in and out of here because...
Ya know, cuz it could be anyone...
Oh, that's right. I forgot.

I knew that Santino was going to have to go through all this. And Fredo...well... Fredo was...well. But I never...I never wanted this for you. I work my whole life, I don't apologize, to take care of my family. And I refused to be a fool dancing on the string, held by all those bigshots. I don't apologize that's my life but I thought that...that when it was your time that...that you would be the one to hold the strings. Senator Corleone. Governor Corleone, or something...
Well this wasn't enough time, Michael. Wasn't enough time...
Uh... Now listen. Whoever comes to you with this Barzini meeting - he's the traitor. Don't forget that.
Come're...come're...come're

Yeah over here...over here. Be careful, you're spilling it. You're spilling it... Anthony...com'ere...com'ere...com'ere... com'ere. There, that's right. We'll put it right there. Aie watch this. Come here. I'll show you something, come here. Now you stand there...
Oh no? That's a new trick. You run in there...run in there...
He came all the way from California to come to the wedding; I told you he was going to come.
He's a good godson.
Signora Corleone!
Hey, come on, let's go... get in the car
All right, start talking.
Woltz is listening.
And ah, what favor would ah your friend ah grant Mr. Woltz?
Are you trying to muscle me?

Now listen to me, you smooth-talking son- of-a-bitch! Let me lay it on the line for you and your boss, whoever he is. Johnny Fontane will never get that movie! I don't care how many daigo guinea WOP greaseball gumbahs come out of the woodwork!
Well let me tell you something my Kraut Mick friend, I'm gonna make so much trouble for you, you won't know what hit you!
I know almost every big lawyer in New York, who the hell are you?
Check him out...
Well, look at this. It used to decorate the palace of a king.
Why didn't you say you worked for Corleone, Tom? I thought you were just some c heap two-bit hustler Johnny was running in trying to bluff me.
How's your drink, Tom?

Hey, come on over here with me; I wanna show you something really beautiful. You do appreciate beauty, don't you? There you are, $600,000 on four hooves. I bet a Russian Czar never paid that kind of dough for a single horse. Khartoum. Khartoum. I'm not gonna race him, though. I'm gonna put him out to stud.
Thanks, Tony.
Let's get something to eat, huh?
I respect that; just tell him he should ask me anything else. But this is one favor I can't give him.

You don't understand. Johnny Fontane never gets that movie. That part is perfect for him; it'll make him a big star. And I'm gonna run him out of the business, and let me tell you why. Johnny Fontane ruined one of Woltz International's most valuable proteges. For five years we had her under training. Singing lessons; acting lessons, dancing lessons. I spent hundreds of thousands of dollars on her. I was gonna make her a big star! And let me be even more frank, just to show you that I'm not a hard-hearted man, and it's not all dollars and cents. She was beautiful; she was young, she was innocent. She was the greatest piece of ass I ever had, and I had'em all over the world! And then Johnny Fontane comes along with his olive-oil voice, and guinea charm. And she runs off. She threw it all away just to make me look ridiculous! And
Is Carlo there?
This is a friend of Carlo's - would you tell him that I can't make it tonight until later?
I also don't believe in drugs. For years I paid my people extra so they wouldn't do that kind of business.

Somebody comes to them and says, "I have powders; if you put up three, four thousand dollar investment we can make fifty thousand distributing." So they can't resist. I want to control it as a business, to keep it respectable. I don't want it near schools. I don't want it sold to children! That's an infamia. In my city, we would keep the traffic in the dark people - the colored. They're animals anyway, so let them lose their souls...
